turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Machines do not EAT message.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Look, I...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Of all the <u>cheap</u> excuses.  To break a child's heart.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Yeh?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Think twice.  Before you <u>ever</u> pull that again.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Annabelle doesn't really want to talk to you right now.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I'm sorry I didn't mean to break your concentration.  I thought it would be a nice moment to rememb...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jackie, if I thought for one moment...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You listen carefully because I am only going to say this once.  That woman has nothing more to do with my children.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I am not <u>here</u> to make it easier for you.  These are <u>my</u> children.  They don't want to <u>be</u> with you.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well, maybe they would if they thought it was okay, with y...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: A court <u>order</u> is gonna say that <u>woman</u> is <u>never</u> <u>alone</u> with my children!  Ever <u>again</u>!  Do you HEAR that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Look, I'm not real comfortable being here, but...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't recall inviting you.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I have a snoop.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I didn't need you to take the blame for me, I'm quite...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I didn't do it for you.  Believe me.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: She already hates me.  You've seen to that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're not terribly good at taking care of h...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I need practice.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Those are <u>my</u> children you're practicing on.  They deserve <u>first-</u> rate care.  Every minute.  Of every night.  And every day.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: So why did y...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I did it for her.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I have an appointment this after- noon.  I need someone to take them to the park.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What?  And have Federal agents jump out of the bushes with court orders? How many years do you get in this state for giving second-rate care to minors?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: However many.  It's not enough.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I'm already on thin ice.  Yesterday, I actually thought my boss was going to fire me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Fine, forget it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Bandaids for cuts.  Bandaids for new shoe blisters.  Packet of Wash n Dri's. Kleenex.  Sugar free lollipops, potty seat covers for public restrooms...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Why not just bring the whole toilet?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ben likes to be read to.  Do you know Dr. Seuss...?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Not personally.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do you have a word limit you need to hit every day or can I finish?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Sorry I'm late, I got lost dropping Ben off at Kevin's.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's okay, it's twenty minutes.  The horse'll be there.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I'm sorry, I just...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Hey.  At least it's not an editing machine.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No way.  I told her two, three years, maybe, for such an expens...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What about obsessively picking her split ends?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Anxiety.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Last week when she chopped her Barbie's bangs all to hell --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: She was angry at herself.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jackie?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: When I twisted hair like this it means I'm intimidated by you...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You feeling all right?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not great.  Plus, I've got things on my mind.  You know.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...thinking of going back to Random House.  On a part-time basis.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Wowie.  How wonderful!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...make some trips into the city. Sometimes, overnight.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hey, any help you need, we'll cover.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Uh.  Have you told Luke and the ki...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Let's...hold up for a bit.  It may not happen.  Our secret, okay?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know wh...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I was looking for Annabelle's book, and I found your tickets.  And the note.  From your new boss.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: My boss.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You're not working at Random House, I talked to them.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You WHAT?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You're taking the kids.  And moving to San Francisco.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Look, you've never liked me...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Don't flatter yourself.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And I know checking into your life was inexcusable...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Nobody likes a snoop.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: But I came here to...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Bi-coastal parenting.  Happens every day.  Luke gets the kids every other summer, every other holiday, it's not ideal, but people make it work, and...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: We can't live like that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Did I hear the word...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Luke.  Can't live like that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Then let him talks to me.  We don't need you to solve our prob...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: ...it's my problem, too.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I got used to...thinking of them. As...my kids too.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Really.  By what right?  Six months of part-time screw-ups?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Life's a trade-off.  You get cancer, your hair falls out, but you <u>do</u> get to smoke dope.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You're not dying.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You bet you are.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How the hell would you know?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't, but...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How would you know <u>anything</u>?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And cigarettes.  I smoke, too.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You are <u>marrying</u> the <u>greatest</u> guy who walks this <u>earth</u>.  Who I have <u>loved</u> from my <u>heart</u> for twelve<u>years</u>!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They came out of my <u>body</u>!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: See, I know that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I have given them more<u>love</u> and more <u>care</u> every fifteen <u>minutes</u> of their lives, than you could manage in the next fifty <u>years</u>!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Okay, I'm undeserving.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ironic, huh?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Small world.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Luke's depo ran late.  I promised I'd take notes.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: So I have to tell you something in confidence...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're a cross-dresser.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: That.  And.  Annabelle is over her head.  With Brad 'The Dreamboat' Kovitsky.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: She hasn't mentioned this.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: She was afraid you'd make a big deal out of it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Moi?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Toi.  They've been 'going out' for two weeks.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: As you may know, 'going out' in the six grade doesn't mean shit.  They don't actually <u>go</u> to a movie or anywhere, they don't even eat lunch together, it's just a declaration to the world that they're...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...going out, yeh.  I had kids of my own, once.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Anyway.  He walks up to her on lunch yard today.  And tells her... publicly...that they're 'breaking up.'

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Right.  Which is the whole <u>point</u> of this 'going out' thing, so one of them can dump the other one, and they can imitate the whole passionate adult soap opera tragedy, without ever having to actually date.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: She's devastated.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Doesn't <u>begin</u> to describe it. I mean, you've got cancer, <u>this</u> is serious.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And you said...?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Beats me.  Ask your mom.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Can I look at the pictures?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's a mess, right now.  That's my project when I get back.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: So.  Hopeful.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's promising, this one.  We're upbeat.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I really look like shit.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You look sick.  But you look... together.  Mentally tough.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeh, that's bull.  I'm going for serene, they say some actually get there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You try to center on the big issues, y'know.  What it's all about.  What this whole trip has meant.  But then, the <u>really</u> big issues keep swamping y...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brad Kovitsky.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The primo stuff is great for pain.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I think my 'primo shit' got left in my 'bellbottoms.'

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He's relentless.  A <u>major</u> asshole.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And you said...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What else?  Keep on keepin' on.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Eat your heart out.  Is Annabelle there?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Yeh, she's...I'll get you Ben first, it's past his bedti...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How's she doing with Brad?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Can I say one thing?  I mean, the <u>last</u> thing I want to do is inter- fere on the Brad thing, b...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Thanks, but it's under control.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Yah?  Well, even the best mom in the world, the smartest, the wisest, whatever.  Needs to know when to find a Plan B.  Cos Plan A <u>is</u> not and <u>will</u> n...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's <u>covered</u>, okay?  I appreciate your concern.  Can I talk to her?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hon, maybe your mom would like t...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...go to the park.  In the worst way.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm thinking.  Do I know you well enough to really chew you out?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's just not the right time t...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do what you've worked your whole life to do?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It was just a job, there'll be plenty of others.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You mean, after I'm dead?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hey, you haven't quit on you, I'm sure as hell not gonna.  I just mean, I'm juggling a lot right n...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Juggle it!  Move the darkroom into your house.  You've got that room downstairs with the treadmill Luke never uses anyway.  Don't lose your confidence.  Don't lose your edge.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's the same choice you made.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yes.  I made the choice that was right for me.  And I don't regret it.  But even for me, there were days when I felt so lost, so invis- ible.  And then I'd hate myself for the kids not being enough.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know you, huh?  The car pools, he measles, the PTA.  It's not gonna be enough for you in the long run.  You have to think long term.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I just want to spend time with them when I'm not rushing or on the phone or tired or...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's motherhood.  That's the job, with or without a career. I'm telling you the biggest gift you can give them is your happiness. They <u>need</u> you to be happy.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: My advice to you?  Don't die.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Feeling the pressure?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Somehow, his blanket always looked like a cape, even the nurse said that.  He <u>loves</u> to hear that story, over and over.  How he was born a magician.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And her...?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Took 28 hours.  She just wasn't sure about entering this world.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: That thing you said before.  Pushing the guy sleeping next to you away. Because of what you gave up for motherhood...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Is that what he told you?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: He won't discuss it.  Just calls it history.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You really didn't have to come, you know.  I'd have brought them straight t...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Who in the world <u>is</u> he?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Looks nice enough to m...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He looks familiar.  Did he do a Calvin Klein ad?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Now we're going to have a fight, you and I.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Are we.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And I'm going to win.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Don't be too sure.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Now, 'limp dick', I know.  What. Is 'snowballing'?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It doesn't matter, I didn't tell h...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Because there'll be, oh, 20 or 30 mothers phoning me in the next hour or so.  And they'll b...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Give 'em my number.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Actually.  They'll want Annabelle's mother.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Is that what you're worried about? Looking bad at the PTA?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You are <u>defending</u> what you did?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Right down to the ground.  Let's get to it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You put filth in my child's mouth.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Aw.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You had her <u>lie</u> about that... that fancy-boy <u>model</u>!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Worked.  Like a charm.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: She was beaten, and bloodied, and it was going to go on, uni...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: So you became the hero.  And I became the schmuck.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You taught my child that I am some limp dick <u>loser</u>.  Who didn't <u>care</u> about her pain.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: That's not wh...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You think <u>I</u> didn't have some dirty words for that little putz?  You think <u>I</u> couldn't figure out some low blows?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You weren't passing 'em out.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, maybe <u>your</u> version of growing up is 'Just win, baby'.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: See, in that crisis, I saw an opportunity.  For some <u>real</u> growth.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh please.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Shut the fuck up.  <u>I</u> didn't go behind <u>your</u> back.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Doing the <u>right</u> thing.  Knowing who you <u>are</u>, inside.  Not <u>caving</u> to peer pressure, or <u>lowering</u> yourself to that level, <u>steering</u> your <u>own</u> course...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: She wasn't steering her own course, she was steering <u>yours</u>.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, that's what parenting is <u>about</u>, little girl.  They are <u>pleading</u> to know how they are supposed to do it. And you sure as hell <u>showed</u> her.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And there will come <u>another</u> moment. When the stakes are <u>really</u> there. And she will look back on this.  And remember how good it felt.  How easy it was.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And she'll fight back again.  God help me, what have I done.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You've turned her into you.  And I may not get another chance.  To turn her back.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: <u>That's</u> what it is.  And that's <u>all</u> it is.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Thanks for coming out.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Neutral ground.  What's up?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: She likes a Stolie, no ice.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Double.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What's this about?  Because we <u>fought</u>?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Don't flatter yourself.  I always liked that line.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I love Luke, I love the children. But there is more to life than even love...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, there isn't.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And I have looked down the road. At what my life will be.  And I can't handle it.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I never wanted to be a mom.  Then, sharing it with you was one thing. Carrying it alone, the rest of my life...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Is scary.  But you want it.  Gimme some truth here.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well, it's the Jack Kennedy Syndrome, huh?  You die young, you always look golden.  Perfect.  The memory kind of burnishes the image, and...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Come on, a wuss like me?  The stiff who wouldn't help her own daughter fight back?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Maybe I was wrong on that one.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You're lying.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I lost him.  I was panicked.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You are lying, you never lost that kid for 4 <u>seconds</u>, you could find him from a <u>coma</u>, there is no WAY!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I was running around like a chicken with my head chopped off.  Doing my imitation of you.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Ben never mentioned it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He only remembers I <u>found</u> him.  My point is, telling you this story would have been the kindest, most helpful thing I could ever have done for you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Why didn't I?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Uh.  You hate my guts?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: With good reason.  They fucking worship you as it is.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What do I have that you don't?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Everything.  You're...the Earth Mother incarnate...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're the hip and fresh.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You ride with Annabelle...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You'll learn.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You know every story, every wound, every memory, their whole life's <u>happiness</u> has been wrapped up in <u>you</u>, every moment...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I have their past.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Now Edna says you short-changed your last meds.  You can do presents and be comfortable at the same time, y'know.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Just want to be a little sharper. For a few minutes.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You know, there's nothing you have to say.  Because they know your heart.  You don't have t...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Just sit me up.  Nice and tall. Bring Benjamin first.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Okay, if they're going to <u>have</u> a sauce, put something <u>in</u> it besides flour and chicken broth...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It was a veal stock, I thi...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well, it wasn't a reduction like you do it!  Boiling down half a ton of bones...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: The way you cook.  If you could make love, I'd marry you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We have to talk.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Uh-oh.  I mention marriage, all of a sudden...  Ve <u>haff</u> to ta...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I didn't want to spoil our supper...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You'd rather spoil our walk home.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yeh, it's cheaper.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I just found out I have to go to Boston to get a deposition.  I might not be back until Saturday.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: So I'll have to order in?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We have the kids this weekend, so...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Anyway, I thought...while I'm gone...maybe I'll hire in some help.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Just a babysitter -- I mean...you're working...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I can take them to work with me -- I can shift things around --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You don't need to.  I don't expect you to handle them yourself.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Can't handle them myself is what you mean.  Can't.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You don't trust me to be alone with them.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I trust you of course I do but --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: But?  But what?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you're not good at this.  Not yet. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I know how responsible, caring adults parent children.  I'm bribe 'em.  But 'em a dog or something.  Maybe a Doberman.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Look.  I know they hate me.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: They don't hate you --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And what you're telling them is keep hating her -- keep up the good work --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Nobody's telling them to hate you --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Really?  Look in your ex-wife's eyes.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's complicated for Jackie.  It's complicated for me...You don't have kids -- you don't understand --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh right...So it's just complicated for you and Jackie -- for me it's pretty simple cause I just don't understand...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: No you don't.  And I'm not gonna screw with my kids heads right now --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You know I don't need another person in this family making me feel like an idiot...your ex-wife's doing a bang up job and I have to face it every Tuesday and Thursday and every other goddamn weekend and I just don't know how the hell you were married to her for so goddamn long!  Jesus what did you see in her?  I don't get it -- I just don't get it.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Get ready.  To get <u>really</u> mad.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Uh.  Annabelle's video report has been switched again.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hey, I sold my body to Satan to clear Friday at two o'clo...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We have the kids.  Next weekend.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: And it's <u>my</u> call.  I promised them water-skiing, instead o...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Our weekend.  At that sweet little B & B.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Why are you taking this out on <u>him</u>?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Rache, get out of th...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You haven't done <u>one</u> goddam thing to make any of this easier...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh my God.  Are you serious?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I think so...What do you think?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I think so too...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's forever you know.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Okay...Is that the good thing or the bad thing?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Because I can't hurt anyone like this ever again.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Everything's gonna work out.  The kids and I...we're going to love each other.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Rache, it may take time.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What's eight, ten years?  Hell, you'll still be ambulatory.  I think.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, I think you should tell him you changed your mi...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's no biggie.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's just an assignment.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's Anna Sui, you should be doing it.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Are you hungry?  You could make us something?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: They're my kids.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Great, wallow in guilt, you <u>sure</u> you're not Jewish?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: She's not gonna die.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I made that paella you liked. It's on the stove.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What a great surpri...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hold your applause.  We're not having fun, here.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Just like to make sure.  That your past.  And my future.  Are real different.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, they will be.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Imagine my relief.  So what's for dinner?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Why in the world would she t...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You took a fishing trip with the boys. Liked it so much, you took another.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I needed some time away.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: ...while she watched the kids.  Then, you booked this flat in Paris for your family's summer.  But she said...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: '...the kids have camp.  Their friends are here.  Over there, I'll just be shopping in a language I don't even know.  My life, and the kids' lives, aren't here to service your mid-life crisis.'  Did it go like that?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: She called it a fight.  <u>The</u> fight.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What do you call it?  You told her you had doubts.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Can we go sit somewhere?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Let me put it this way.  Hell, no.
